When your metabolism is low, your  body will be unable to use the glucose, and thus, insulin will convert  it into fat. The body stores the fat molecules in the muscle and liver  cells as the adipose tissue. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":93}],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":0,"length":93}],"data":{}},{"key":"2gnn2","text":"#1 Sleep problems","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"flhqq","text":"One  of the leading causes of obesity is lack of sleep.
